citations.narrative:
3.13(a)
The last kennel visit and head to tail exams for each dog that includes the heartworm and fecal testing were last
completed by the attending veterinarian on April 28, 2023, which exceeds the required 12-month timeframe. Regularly
scheduled visits to the kennel by the attending veterinarian ensures the adequacy of veterinarian care and other aspects
of animal care. Failure to have each dog examined at least once a year can result in delay of treatment and diagnosis for
disease, illness, or injury. Correct by having the attending veterinarian complete a kennel visit and head-to-tail exams with
the required testing. Schedule future visits and exams not less than once every 12 months.
Correct by July 15, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
3.13(a) 
The last kennel visit and head to tail exams for each dog that includes the heartworm and fecal testing were last 
completed by the attending veterinarian on April 28, 2023, which exceeds the required 12-month timeframe. Regularly 
scheduled visits to the kennel by the attending veterinarian ensures the adequacy of veterinarian care and other aspects 
of animal care. Failure to have each dog examined at least once a year can result in delay of treatment and diagnosis for 
disease, illness, or injury. Correct by having the attending veterinarian complete a kennel visit and head-to-tail exams with 
the required testing. Schedule future visits and exams not less than once every 12 months.  
 
Correct by July 15, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
